intro: Palicourea vulcanalis, commonly known as the volcanic palicourea, is a species of flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to red as they mature, attracting various bird species. Palicourea vulcanalis is often found in shaded undergrowth, thriving in nutrient-rich soils near rivers and streams.
